definition: to appear in the news/in the papers
to see/to meet/to appear (to be sth)/to interview

sentences.english: Writing the business reported the advertisement.
You surely won't print (ie publish, esp in a newspaper) such a scandalous allegation.
sentences.chinese: 你绝不会让这种造谣中伤的言论披露见报的吧。

sentences.english: You surely won't print (ie publish, esp in a newspaper ) such a scandalous allegation.
sentences.chinese: 你绝不会让这种造谣中伤的言论披露见报的吧。

sentences.english: Reports on this conference will appear in tomorrow's newspapers.
sentences.chinese: 有关这次会议的报道明日即可见报。

sentences.english: He conceived that it would be fine to let that event apprise Ruth of his return.
sentences.chinese: 他设想最好以文章见报的方式告诉露丝他已回来了。

sentences.english: The police report that the drugs had been found appeared in the press yesterday.
sentences.chinese: 毒品已经被发现这一警察报告昨天见报了。

sentences.english: The announcement of their marriage appeared in the newspaper.
sentences.chinese: 他们的结婚启事已见报了。

sentences.english: The announcement will appear in tomorrow'snewspapers.

definition: to log out (computer)/to publish/to be published/to appear (in a newspaper etc)
(of a piece of writing) long and tedious (idiom)/verbose
Wen Wei Po (Hong Kong newspaper)/Wenhui News (Shanghai newspaper)
announcement (written, on billboard, letter, newspaper or website)/to post information/a notice
